meanings.definition: The leader or head of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The chiefs of the company gathered to discuss the new project.
meanings.sent2: The chiefs of the team made important decisions for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent3: The chiefs of the book club argued over the next novel to read.
meanings.sent4: She was the chief of the household, managing all the chores and schedules.
meanings.sent5: The chiefs of the council wore distinguished hats to signify their authority.

meanings.definition: The highest-ranking officer in a police or fire department.
meanings.sent1: The police chiefs coordinated the efforts to catch the criminal.
meanings.sent2: The fire chiefs rushed to the scene of the burning building.
meanings.sent3: The chiefs of the police station enjoyed donuts during their break.
meanings.sent4: He was the chief of the fire department, leading his team with bravery.
meanings.sent5: The chiefs of the police force wore badges of honor on their uniforms.

meanings.definition: The head of a tribe or clan.
meanings.sent1: The tribal chiefs gathered to discuss the upcoming harvest.
meanings.sent2: The clan chiefs led their people through times of hardship.
meanings.sent3: The chiefs of the tribe celebrated with a feast after a successful hunt.
meanings.sent4: She was the chief of the clan, respected by all for her wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The chiefs of the village wore traditional headdresses during ceremonies.
